fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43281].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

When user tried to export 170,283 events from Audit Log, the export function say that only 100,000 newest events will be exported.

*Suggested Solution*

Please have an option where user can choose to export all the existing events in Audit Log without limitation.
fields.summary: Enable users to export all the events in Audit Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43280].
  {panel}

I am trying to use our instance of JIRA for asset management. I have two tables, one for service users, one for assets. I am using links to identify those assets being used by a user.
When I create a link and add a comment (Link Asset-7224 to User-869), that is fine. It shows the comment on the Asset, and that there is a link on the user (if I look at "ALL" in the activitiy of the issue).
However, If I go to the asset and delete the link to the user, what shows is
ASSET HISTORY: Admin made changes - 8 minutes ago
                              Link 	This issue alloc'd to USER-869 [ USER-869 ] 	 
USER HISTORY:  Admin made changes - 9 minutes ago
                              Link 	This issue alloc'd to ASSET-7224 [ ASSET-7224 ]

Additionally, if I go to the user record (user-869) and then use the Activity tab within Activity on the issue (as it's a little prettier), it tells you 
    "Admin: Admin removed the Link of USER-869 - JO HARDMAN
                 Core10 minutes ago"
But that is not what has happened. What has happened is the deletion of the link to Asset-7224. It makes no sense making the Activity bit unusable, and the ALL bit unusable.

Why does the ALL tab not say that the link is removed? or the ACTIVITY tab not say what has been removed?  We need to keep a history of the links for the whole service desk. Any advice would be appreciated as at present, this is unworkable and we may need to look at another solution.
(see attached for examples of what the ALL and ACTIVITY tabs show for each issue being linked/link removed.)
fields.summary: Link deletion shows as change but not deletion.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43279].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When using JIRA external activity stream gadget integrated with Confluence and 2LO with impersonation, the "Login & Approve" prompt still appears. When using Trusted Applications, the prompt doesn't appear and loads normally. 

Atlassian recommends using 2LO with impersonation and is mandatory for integration with JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
When using JIRA Issues Macro, this doesn't require the "Login & Approve" prompt. The external gadgets should do the same and acknowledge the impersonation so that the prompt is not required.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use Confluence's Activity Stream gadget.
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream Gadget Prompts "Login & Approve" using OAuth with Impersonation
Use Foreground Indexing during Index Recovery?

fields.description:
tl;dr Cloning issue ignores Requirements for having Versions field populated

h4. Problem
Project requires that the "Affects Version/s" field be populated on new issue creation. If you clone an existing issue ticket that contains *archived* versions, the newly cloned ticket will not contain archived versions, this is the result of JRA-9005. The problem is that the current behaviour also results in the new cloned ticket have no defined "Affects Version/s", even if it is required. There is no warning or indication that "Affects Version/s" needs to be populated

h4. Expected Behaviour
As "Affect/s Version" is a required field, it's expected that the user  has to input a new version for the cloned issue ticket.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a project with a version
# Ensure that the the "Affects Version/s" field is marked as "Required" in the field config scheme
# Create a new issue ticket, populating the "Affects Version/s" field
# Archive the versions in the project
# Clone the issue ticket
# Notice that the newly cloned ticket's "Affects Version/s" field is blank
** There were no prompts, errors, or any indication that "Affects Version/s" field needs to be populated.
fields.summary: Clone issue ignores Version required as a field constraints when the original issue only contain archived versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43275].
  {panel}

In some cases a JIRA user may not understand that he needs to escape special characters in a JIRA JQL when using special characters, such as {{?}}, {{*}}.

It would be nice if we had a better mention in our documentations for JIRA Search filters:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Filters
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Searching+for+Issues
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching
Advising that some text filters may not work because of the special character not escaped.

A link to this documentation may prevent friction:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-Escapingspecialcharacters:\or\\
fields.summary: Improve "Search Filter" documentations regarding special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43274].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no method for JIRA to perform any data validation/detection when it comes to checking the integrity of the data within JIRA. As a result, whenever there is any problems with the integrity of the data within JIRA, it does not get detected beforehand. As a result, sometimes the problem is only detected when it's too late (for example, when upgrading).

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we have some sort of method or tool that can detect and validate the integrity of the data in an instance. This way many data integrity issues can be detected early and solved. The current Integrity Checker does not seem to be able to detect these issues. Perhaps a health check tool instead?
fields.summary: As an admin, I want JIRA to be able to detect/validate data integrity of the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A java warning pop-up "Firefox has prevented the unsafe plugin "Java" from running on .." (see attachment) while trying to login to JIRA. Pop up is coming up even tho JIRA does not need the use of JAVA applet in the login page.

h3. Environment
* Firefox with _Java Deployment Toolkit_ installed (see [^toolkit.png]).
* Windows only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# You will need to ensure in your firefox, your java is installed. Can you checked your java here https://www.java.com/en/download/installed.jsp
# Go to your firefox setting, add-on. Go to Plugins. Ensure "Java Deployment Toolkit" is present
# Open Firefox (with the Java Deployment Toolkit installed);
# Access the JIRA dashboard.
# Notice there will be a red warning on the left side of the browser URL box, click on it the warning message will be displayed.

This is demonstrated in the two attached videos:
* [^toolkit_warning.mov]
* [^on_older_versions.mov]

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA should not cause Firefox to try to run the Java Deployment Toolkit.

h3. Actual Results
* The warning pop-up "Firefox has prevented the unsafe plugin "Java" from running on .." (see attachment) is displayed.
 
h3. Notes
Firefox is not blocking Java per se, instead it is blocking the Java Development Toolkit from running. [What the toolkit does|https://www.java.com/en/download/faq/deployment_toolkit.xml] in this case is simply get the version of Java installed. Consequently, there are no side effects of this not running.

Internet Explorer 11 seems to be affected also by a previously downloaded java deployment toolkit. In this case, the browser will prompt the user to let JIRA run java although it's not required for JIRA to function.

h3. Workaround
Please ignore the warning. The Java Deployment Toolkit plugin is known to be insecure and is unnecessary in most cases and therefore it was blocked by Firefox as per https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/blocked/p428.
fields.summary: Java Deployment Toolkit , Pop up JAVA plugin browser warning

As an administrator I would like the ability to hide child groups when using nested groups with my LDAP connector

Example use case:
* I have a large number of users spread out across multiple regions
* Users are members of regional groups
* I would to add my regional groups to a single jira-users group and have this group show up in JIRA, and all users in the regional member groups receive the jira-users group in JIRA.
* I do not want or need JIRA to show the regional groups. I only want the parent jira-users group
fields.summary: Ability to hide child groups when using nested user groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43260].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When modifying a Workflow Scheme, the following error is displayed: "A issue type with ID ‘10200’ does not exist"
 !issue_type.jpeg! 

*Cause:*
The Issue Type has been deleted but it is still linked to the workflow.

h3. Environment
This is the most up to date JIRA Cloud environment, but is likely present on JIRA Server as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete any issue type for that is being used by an active workflow.
# Attempt to edit the workflow scheme.

h3. Expected Results
Workflow scheme is editable.

h3. Actual Results
You will encounter an error similar to "A issue type with ID '10200' does not exist.
The ID will be different but the error message will be the same.
 
h3.Workaround
*Option A)* Recreate the Workflow Scheme from scratch (not Copy scheme as the copy contains the corruption) and reassign Projects to that new Scheme.

*Option B)* Manually fix the database:
The current discovered workaround is to find the Scheme Entity in the DB and remove it, which will remove the link between the issue type and workflow. The following SQL was run in the DB to remove all traces of the issue type that had been deleted. Please note that the issuetype (in this case '10200') will be the number in the error message.
{noformat}select * from workflowschemeentity where issuetype = '10200';
  id   | scheme |        workflow        | issuetype
-------+--------+------------------------+-----------
 10706 |  10700 | FDBUGS Workflow | 10200
(1 row)
{noformat}
Manually delete the relation of that Issue Type to active and inactive workflow schemes:
{noformat}delete from workflowschemeentity where issuetype = '10200';
delete from draftworkflowschemeentity where issuetype = '10200';
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Workflow Scheme with error Issue Type does not exist
Rename "Move All Sub-tasks" to something that matches its behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43258].
  {panel}

We're running JIRA with the Agile/Scrum plugin.  During a sprint, sometimes the scope or nature of a story changes due to new requirements or discoveries.  We sometimes need to move a portion of a story's sub-tasks in to a new one, and push it in to our backlog.

The current process involves:

# Creating the story or stories we need to move the sub-tasks too (unless they already exist, which is rare).
# Navigating to the story that hosts the sub-tasks we need to move.
# Select the "More \ Move All Sub-tasks" feature
# Select the sub-tasks to move
# Select the story to move them to
# Then select "Move Sub-tasks"

A simpler experience would be not to create the target stories in preparation of the move.  Rather just create the story inline with the move process:

#...
# Select the sub-tasks to move
# Select "Create a new story"
# Then select "Move Sub-tasks"
# Present the "Create" pop-up window
# Create the story and save

This helps keep the team workflow in line with the conversation and simplifies the overall effort.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to create new stories while moving sub-tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43255].
  {panel}

When starting a new instance of latest JIRA, a 12 step tour is proposed to discover the functionalities of the app. Unfortunately it does not seem to be skippable. Although a good intention, making this unskippable is quite the annoyance when you are a knowledgeable user simply setting up a brand new instance.

Adding a skip button would be appreciated.

*Workaround:*
# As a JIRA administrator, navigate to _<JIRA-URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_
# Add the following dark feature flag: _jira.onboarding.feature.disabled_
fields.summary: 'Welcome To JIRA' tour

It states here that it is not currently possible, but will in the future.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Administering+Bitbucket+and+GitHub+with+JIRA

What I'm keen to suggest is that this includes some sort of 'merge' facility when it launches everything done with my Bitbucket user can be merged to my OnDemand account and I can remove the second user.

I'm sure this is on the map already, but am keen that it is included.
fields.summary: Link JIRA OnDemand with Bitbucket

fields.description:
There was an entry in the log from 4/20 that showed an Administrator adding a new user to the "jira-administrators" group.  This was an unauthorized addition, so they were both removed from the "jira-administrators" group.  Now the entry that showed the unauthorized addition is gone.  Also, the changes I made to remove both of the users from the "jira-administrators" group are not present in the audit log.

CORRECTION:
The group management entries for jira-administrators is being logged as an LDAP server entry.  I had the "Hide external user directories box" checked.
fields.summary: Audit Log "group management" entries for local group "jira-administrators" is being logged as an External user directory entry

fields.description:
When exporting the audit log, the export file is empty.  The prompt will give you a number of entries that will be exported (truncated to the 100,000 newest events), yet when you open the export file, it is empty.  I have attached the audit log zip file.

*Edit with root cause:*

In tomcat logs there are following exceptions:

{code}
SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet default threw exception
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, LOG_ID, OBJECT_TYPE, OBJECT_ID, OBJECT_NAME, OBJECT_PARENT_ID, OBJECT_PARENT_NAME FROM jiraschema.audit_item WHERE (LOG_ID IN  [...]
(Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:534)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:349)
        at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.consumeWith(SelectQueryImpl.java:234)
        at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.visitWith(SelectQueryImpl.java:253)
        at com.atlassian.jira.auditing.AuditingStoreImpl.getItems(AuditingStoreImpl.java:293)
        at com.atlassian.jira.auditing.AuditingStoreImpl.getAuditRecords(AuditingStoreImpl.java:249)
        at com.atlassian.jira.auditing.AuditingStoreImpl.getRecords(AuditingStoreImpl.java:195)
        at com.atlassian.jira.auditing.AuditingManagerImpl.getRecords(AuditingManagerImpl.java:108)
        at com.atlassian.jira.auditing.AuditingManagerImpl.getRecords(AuditingManagerImpl.java:82)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2802.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy296.getRecords(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2802.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
[...]


{code}

This is reproducible only with MSSQL when exporting more than 2000 records, because MSSQL allows only for 2000 placeholder values in prepared statements. Also it affects Audit Log only in JIRA 6.3.5 and above since from that point there is an optimization introduced that results in prepare statements with long lists of place holders.
fields.summary: Audit Log export is empty when exporting more than 2000 records on MSSQL

fields.description:
h5. Problem
An issue occurs where filter result gadget have fields that were specified in them going missing after an update from JIRA 6.3.15 to JIRA 6.4.X.
- This occurs to random Filter Result gadgets.
-* _Usually the only field left on the table would be Due Date(as seen on the gadget)_

h5. Steps to Replicate:
# Create a JIRA 6.3.15 with sample data and multple filter result gadgets on the dashboard.
# Upgrade the instance to JIRA 6.4.X(also occurs if data is restored between the versions)
# Check the Dashboard and you should notice that some filters would have their specified fields missing.
# When you check the database, you should notice a change in the content of the fields data under userprefvalue field in gadgetuserpreference table.

h5. Workaround:
# If you know the expected fields that went missing you could either add them back manually by editing each field or in the case you want to perform a bulk change then you would need to do this from the database:
#* (i) Backup your database
#* {code}SELECT portletconfiguration.id, gadgetuserpreference.portletconfiguration,gadgetuserpreference.userprefvalue, portletconfiguration.portalpage, portletconfiguration.gadget_xml 
FROM gadgetuserpreference LEFT JOIN PORTLETCONFIGURATION ON gadgetuserpreference.portletconfiguration = portletconfiguration.id 
WHERE gadget_xml like '%filter-results-gadget.xml' AND userprefvalue ='--Default--|duedate';//Query the database for matching field ids between portletconfiguration and gadgetuserpref tables{code}(_This should give you a list of all affected data based on my sample scenario described above, though you need to be careful of filters that have a different configuration and are affected as well_
#* Update the fields using this code: {code}UPDATE gadgetuserpreference
SET userprefvalue = '--Default--|issuetype|issuekey|summary|priority|duedate'
WHERE userprefvalue = '--Default--|duedate'//update set value should be based on what is missing{code}
#* This should fix broken gadgets in the JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Missing Fields in Filter Result Gadget After update from JIRA 6.3.15 to JIRA 6.4.X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43233].
  {panel}

Background:

When using an internal user directory with delegated LDAP authentication, a user record is typically not created in JIRA until the user logs in for the first time, which makes it difficult (impossible) to modify permissions on users in advance.

Suggestion:

Provide a an option (check box) to "force authenticate" users so admin can modify user permission, assigning issues in advance
fields.summary: Provide option to Force authenticate users in JIRA with Delegated LDAP authentication

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.3
# Update *HipChat for JIRA* to v6.24.0
#* In my installation, there isn't any *Update* button, so I manually downloaded it from [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin/versions] and uploaded it
# Manage the add-on

h4. Expected behaviour
# All modules are enabled and everything is working fine

h4. Actual behaviour
# All modules are not enabled and the following message appears
{code}This add-on couldn't be loaded. It has one or more errors that prevent it from being enabled.{code}
!1.png|thumbnail!
# The following stack trace is thrown in the logs
{noformat}2015-05-04 20:14:34,160 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-3 ERROR admin 1148x387x2 191qqg0 127.0.0.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/available/recent [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] There was an error loading the descriptor 'new-issue-command' of plugin 'com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin'. Disabling.
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/plugins/hipchat/api/webhooks/HipChatCommandBehaviour
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:2615)

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:134)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy40.installPlugins(Unknown Source)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)

Note.
# This also affects older versions of JIRA 
#* I've tested updating to this version with JIRA 6.4 and ran into the same problem

h4. Workaround
Users must roll back to version 6.22 and below to get HipChat working again
# Download Hipchat Plugin v6.22 using the following link
#* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.hipchat.hipchat-for-jira-plugin/version/126
# Navigate to the *Manage add-ons* page
# Choose *All add-ons* from the drop down list beside the search box
# Uninstall the following add-ons
{code}Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core
HipChat for JIRA{code}
# Upload the obr file you downloaded in the Step 1 and install it
fields.summary: Hipchat for JIRA plugin v6.24.0 is broken

Project Specific Announcements

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce:

# Edit the description of an issue, and click "Style", then hover one of the options. !screenshot-2.png!
# Press ESC

Here's the result of doing it a few times !screenshot-1.png!.

As you can see the tipsies get orphaned.
fields.summary: Pressing ESC to dismiss Style menu orphans tipsies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43226].
  {panel}

I suggest that to help the users quicker understand content in dashboard possiblity for dashbboard onwer to:
1) add a free text describing the dashboard (new gadget).
2) add gadget titles (free text) 
3) default text for some gadget can be removed, e.g.  "Filter Results", "Two Dimenional Filter Result", "Pie Chart", is of absolutely no interest to the user (who looks at Dashboard), and can be be removed. 

Maybe the user could chose between showing gadget default title or creats its own.

--

Rational: 
The dashboard user needs information what content is showed in the gadget. 
Previsouly I did be given by chosing the name of filter visely (this is no long possible refer to JIRA-42723. In 6.2 and ealier, I gave the filter a name like "Project Name - Defects - priority distribution", and that was shown as a "title").

From a user point of view I think the current default text, e.g.  "Filter Results", "Two Dimenional Filter Result", "Pie Chart", is of absolutely no interest to the user (who looks at Dashboard), and can be be removed.
fields.summary: Improve dashboard usiblity by adding free text gadget titles and dashboard description text

fields.description:
When you're at the sign-in screen (for any account I guees), there's a little menu up in the top right corner with three links:

*Sign-in help* (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Logging+in+to+Atlassian+OnDemand)
*Documentation* (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+Documentation+Home)
*Answers* (https://answers.atlassian.com/?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fanswers.atlassian.com%2F&application=acac)

The first two returns a Page Not Found, which isn't that helpful (plus it lowers your trustability to not have correct help at the login point - "is it really Jira I'm logging in to, the help section is missing?").
fields.summary: Help links returns 404
Update 6.4 Stable to bundle Issue Nav Components 6.5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43223].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When migrating from Cloud to Server, the directory poller job is not removed for the previous Crowd User Directory (aka Horde).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Export from a JIRA Cloud instance.
# Import it into JIRA Server.

h3. Expected Results

There are no noticeable errors.

h3. Actual Results

The following exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2015-05-04 10:45:36,829 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 ERROR      [com.atlassian.scheduler.JobRunnerResponse] Unable to synchronise directory
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory <10000> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.runJob(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{noformat}

Additionally viewing the Scheduler Administration page will present errors as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Workaround

You can remove the orphaned job directly from the database as per our [Directory Sync Throws Error "Directory <2> does not exist"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/directory-sync-throws-error-directory-2-does-not-exist-715132254.html] KB article.

h3. Notes

When this is fixed, please include an upgrade task to clean up existing records, or some provide some SQL as a workaround that can be used to fix the problem.
fields.summary: Exporting from JIRA Cloud does not remove Directory Synchronisation Job resulting in Directory does not exist errors
Isse Nav Button background on a slow internet connection goes into repeat mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JIRA Internal Directory error warning is a bit confusing, specifically it lists the below:

{quote}
You cannot edit this directory because you are logged in through it, please log in as a locally authenticating user to edit it.
{quote}

However you can still edit it, just not disable it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log in as a user in the JIRA Internal Directory.
# Browse to User Directories.

h3. Expected Results

The page lists the following error, or none at all:

{quote}
You cannot *disable* this directory because you are logged in through it, please log in as a *external* authenticating user to *disable* it.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

It lists the provide error above.
fields.summary: JIRA Internal Directory lists 'You cannot edit this directory' even though it can be edited.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43220].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 30 July 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}

Hey guys!

With the release of Windows 10 and Microsoft Edge there are surely customers who are interested in knowing when JIRA (and our other products) will support Microsoft Edge. 

Atlassian fully intends to support Microsoft Edge and are working to do so in a reasonable timeframe. We should see Edge support coming to JIRA in Q4 2015 at the earliest. Circumstances may change this timeframe in the coming months, and if so I will make sure I keep everyone watching this issue in the loop.
 
Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Kind Regards,

Kerrod Williams
[kwilliams@atlassian.com|mailto:kwilliams@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

Request for inclusion of [Microsoft Edge|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/browser-for-doing] in JIRA supported platform.
fields.summary: Support Microsoft Edge Browser for JIRA

fields.description:
I have a reproducible bug where attaching a .txt file and a .png file in the same (multi-file) upload action causes the "Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachmentmodule'." error to appear.

Attaching each separately is fine. Going in, removing all attachments, then re-attaching each separately resolves the issue as well.

This was under v6.3.15#6346-sha1:dbc023d

I do not know if the underlying error is still present in version 6.4, because of the new upload interface that technically uploads each file individually even when bulk uploading, the problem does *not* appear in v6.4.3#64018-sha1:4550402 - it is not possible to confirm it has actually been fixed on my end.

I have attached the full log for the test case described.
fields.summary: Attaching differing mime types simultaneously causes Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachmentmodule'.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43218].
  {panel}

According to [Specify your license key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+the+Setup+Wizard#RunningtheSetupWizard-Step3.Specifyyourlicensekey], there're 3 ways to enter a license key:
# register an Atlassian ID and get a license key, if the user doesn't have an account yet
# sign in with Atlassian ID and get a license key, if the user already has an account
# manually enter a license key, if the user already has a license key
{panel}(i) Among these, Server ID is only displayed if the user selects method 3, which doesn't really make sense as the user already has a license key and simply needs to enter the key without caring about the Server ID.{panel}

In some cases, users already have an account but no key, and for some reason method 2 does not work for them (probably network issue). Due to this, they manually log in https://my.atlassian.com and click to generate a New Evaluation License, where they're asked to provide a Server ID. At this step, Server ID is nowhere to be found if users are not curious enough to click to see method 3, where it is displayed.

*Suggestion*
{panel}Server ID should be displayed explicitly at Specify Your License Key step in the Setup Wizard, no matter which method is selected.{panel}

*Notes*
On https://my.atlassian.com/license/evaluation, the guide to get Server ID seems to be obsolete, showing an old Setup Wizard where Server ID was explicitly presented:
!serverid.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the way Server ID is presented in the Setup Wizard
Add a female avatar silhouette for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43216].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Browse Users permissions defaults to JIRA-Developers on a new install.  We would like service-desk-agents to automatically be added when Service Desk is installed on an instance so that those users can perform @mentions and browse users. 

h3. Workaround 
- Manually Update Global Permissions to include service-desk-agents
-or -
- Add service-desk-agents to jira-developers group
fields.summary: Add service-desk-agent Group to Browse User Global Permission on Install of Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43211].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce.

1. Download the JIRA 6.4.3 source distribution from www.atlassian.com 
2. {{gunzip atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source.tar.gz && tar -xvf atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source.tar}}
3. {{unzip dependencySources/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.33-sources.jar}} 

h2. Expected Behaviour

I expect to see an exploded folder containing all the sources files from [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin/src/jira-inline-issue-create-parent-0.3.3/plugin/src/main/scala/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/issue/create/]

h2. Actual behaviour

The contents of the sources jar is missing the compiled Scala files

{noformat}
 yeah-yeah in ~/Downloads/jira-source/atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source/dependencySources/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.3.3-sources
○ → ls -la
total 176
drwxr-xr-x    8 jclark  staff    272 May  1 13:39 .
drwxr-xr-x  331 jclark  staff  11254 May  1 13:39 ..
drwxr-xr-x    4 jclark  staff    136 Apr 14 13:26 META-INF
drwxr-xr-x    3 jclark  staff    102 Apr 14 13:25 analytics
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff  11925 Apr 14 13:25 atlassian-plugin.xml
drwxr-xr-x    6 jclark  staff    204 Apr 14 13:25 inline-issue-create
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff  70258 May  1 13:39 jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.3.3-sources.jar
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff    738 Apr 14 13:25 jira-inline-issue-create-plugin.properties
{noformat}
fields.summary: Scala source files are missing from the jira-inline-issue-create-plugin source jar
Allow users to import private workflows from Marketplace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43208].
  {panel}

We're using JIRA 6.4.1.  Currently, JIRA uses relative dates for the first 7 days, then switches to absolute dates.  We would like to be able to configure the number of days before converting to absolute dates.  For example, it would be nice to set this to only 3 days.  It would also be nice to be able to change this setting on a per-user basis.

We know that it's possible to [disable relative dates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+Relative+Dates+in+JIRA] completely, but that doesn't get what we want.  We are also aware that hovering over the relative date shows the absolute date.  Again, this isn't quite enough and requires action from the user as opposed to being able to quickly glance at a screen to see the right level of information.

What we'd like is :
# To be able to set a User Default value for the number of relative days before converting to absolute dates.  
# To allow users to override this preference individually in their profile.
# To allow users to effectively disable relative dates by setting the preference to {{0}} days, meaning always show absolute dates.

*NOTE:* This is in addition to the request to [Display Relative Dates with Times|JRA-42780]
fields.summary: Configure Relative Date Display Preferences

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43207].
  {panel}

We have some components that have adopted this naming convention:

abc:orange
abc:apple
abc:grape

You can't partial patch by typing "apple" because the client-side javascript only seems to tokenize the words by spaces. Can we include non-alpha characters too?
fields.summary: Autocomplete fields should partial match on non-alpha characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43206].
  {panel}

As an user, when I click in one point of the chart in the *Average Number of Times in Status* gadget, I would like to see a list of the issues associated with that point in the chart. Today, when I click in one point, I will just be redirected to a search with the filter or project I have configured in the gadget associated with the period I set up.

When I click in the point in this chart I should see only one issue:
!number_of_times_gadget.png|thumbnail!

but I see this:
!filter_time.png|thumbnail!

Average Number of Times in Status is provided by the JIRA Charting plugin.
fields.summary: Better results after clicking in a plot point in the Average Number of Times in Status gadget.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43200].
  {panel}

*Summary*
JIRA image attachment thumbnail in 6.5-OD-01-120 has lower quality of thumbnail compare to JIRA image attachment thumbnail in 6.4-OD-15-055

As you can see in the below comparison:

- JIRA 6.4-OD-15-055: !6.4-OD-15-055-thumbnail.png|thumbnail!
- JIRA 6.5-OD-01-120: !6.5-OD-01-120-thumbnail.png|thumbnail!

Reciprocal between two JIRA server through REST API is not available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43198].
  {panel}

In the page *Configuring JIRA Options* there are couple of options which are not configurable in JIRA Cloud and that does confuse the customer.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUD/Configuring+JIRA+Options

h3. Options that are not configurable in JIRA Cloud

# General Settings: Mode 
This is only configurable in user management page : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Enabling+Self+Sign+Up
# General Settings: CAPTCHA on signup
# Options : Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy
# Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed

h3. Suggestion 
We should include the line "(info) This option is not available for JIRA Cloud." for the features listed above.
fields.summary: Configuring JIRA Options documentation in Cloud Space need to be updated
Second dialog of the Issue nav feature discovery is misaligned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43196].
  {panel}

1. Create a task.
2. Create subtasks A, B and C
3. Move B up so that the order is B, A, C
4. Run the search REST API method with jql=key=<issue key>
Expected result: the subtask order in the reply JSON is B, A, C
Actual result: the order is A, B, C

Note that the 'issue' REST method returns sub-tasks in a correct order.
fields.summary: Subtasks are returned in the wrong order from the search REST API method

fields.description: When you use the user rename function in Jira, if the user is part of any filters that are shared by other users, the username is not changed in the saved JQL.
fields.summary: User rename does not rename username in shared filters
Ability to paste color coded and bolded text e-mails into the detailed description field of JIRA while maintaining those highlighted item
Ability to do a spellcheck

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43187].
  {panel}

Allow SLA reporting based on each status in the workflow.

*How:*
# Customer set up a Workflow with different status.
# Add SLA functionality to JIRA.
# Customer sets up SLA for each status so they can get escalations and know what status the issue breached SLA.

Thanks.

Ismael
fields.summary: SLA for each Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43186].
  {panel}

At the moment, Log Work entry will be recorded and shown under *Work Log* tab, as shown below
!first.png|thumbnail!

When user edits the entered work log, the previous value is no longer stated. neither under *History* tab nor *Work Log* tab. The previous value is also not recorded in the database, (as the new value has replaced it in _worklog_ table). The entry in _changeitem_ table only records the worklog ID instead of the value the user entered. 
!second.png|thumbnail!

It would be better to have the previous value recorded and shown under *Work Log* tab, as other changes recorded under *History* tab.
fields.summary: Keep the history of the previous WorkLog entered

fields.description: When logging work on a issue before estimating it,  the Remaining estimate continue set to 0 after estimating
fields.summary: Remaining estimate not changing
Add the ability to disable verbose error messages output in the browser

fields.description:
Ran into an apparent bug on our self-hosted instance of JIRA. When we added the 'security level' field to our screens, no users (including users with project roles that can "set issue security" in the permission scheme editor) could see the Security Level field and using the "Where's my field?" function returned a status of:

bq. The 'Security Level' field is not present on the form you are viewing

with a description of:

bq. The 'Security Level' field is not included in the 'Default User Story Screen' screen configured for this issue. To solve this problem, go to 'Default User Story Screen' Screen configuration settings and add the field.

The screen configurations were all correct - the field should have been showing.

We were able to get around this by creating a custom single-line text field also called "Security Level" with some random text as a default value, making both visible on the default screen scheme, and then hiding the dummy custom field. This made the real field visible on-screen and work as expected.
fields.summary: 'Security Level' field hidden even when set to 'shown' on field configurations

fields.description: Performing a project level reindex on one node in a JIRA cluster should trigger a similar reindex on other nodes in a cluster. This message is sometimes not acted upon by the other nodes, causing them to see stale data in their indexes.
fields.summary: Project reindex may not replicate across a JIRA cluster
Managing Project Permissions so that project admins do not have rights to add groups in projects

fields.description:
Chrome has deprecated the NPAPI which has made attaching a screenshot useless. Any plans to implement a solution for this? 

h5. Temporary workaround
{quote}
If you must use a NPAPI plugin, there’s a temporary workaround that will work until Chrome version 45 is released later in 2015:

# Open Chrome.
# In the address bar at the top of the screen, type {{chrome://flags/#enable-npapi}}
# In the window that opens, click the link that says *Enable* under the *Enable NPAPI* flag
# In the bottom left corner of the page, click the Relaunch Now button

After the release of Chrome version 45, you’ll need to use an alternate web browser to load content that requires a NPAPI plugin.
{quote}
Source: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/6213033
fields.summary: Cannot add screenshots due to Java being disabled by Chrome

Page refreshes, but no interface to create the board pops up.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43176].
{panel}
There is an additional library for Tomcat that allows for optimal performance, namely additional OS functionality and the ability for Tomcat to handle OpenSSL certificates. From Apache:
{quote}Tomcat can use the Apache Portable Runtime to provide superior scalability, performance, and better integration with native server technologies. The Apache Portable Runtime is a highly portable library that is at the heart of Apache HTTP Server 2.x. APR has many uses, including access to advanced IO functionality (such as sendfile, epoll and OpenSSL), OS level functionality (random number generation, system status, etc), and native process handling (shared memory, NT pipes and Unix sockets).
{quote}
Please include this by default in our Tomcat standalone installations - OpenSSL certificates are much easier to handle than JKS.

If it's not configured, the below error message will appear:
{noformat}
INFO: The APR based Apache Tomcat Native library which allows optimal performance in production environments was not found on the java.library.path: /Users/dcurrie/Library/Java/Extensions:/Library/Java/Extensions:/Network/Library/Java/Extensions:/System/Library/Java/Extensions:/usr/lib/java:.
{noformat}
There is no negative side effects to not having this installed - it's simply an info message.
h3. Workaround

(i) A forewarning disclaimer:
 _This workaround includes steps to customize or extend Atlassian software (adding/changing CSS rules, HTML, JavaScript, etc.). Per the Atlassian Support Offerings, support does not include customizations made to Atlassian products. Be aware that this material is provided for your information only and using it is done so at your risk._

_If you have any questions about this or any customization, please ask the community at Atlassian Answers or consider working with an Atlassian Solution Partner._

Here's the actual workaround:
A non stock APR can be installed as per [https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/apr.html].
fields.summary: Include the APR based Apache Tomcat Native Library by default in Standalone installations
confirmation for getting notifications should be confirmed by a token by the contact

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43174].
  {panel}

When creating an issue on most pages in JIRA, if you close the browser or tab during the creation you get a popup saying "Do you want to stay on this page or leave", basically confirming that you want to discard your changes to the form on the page.

When viewing an Agile Board, however, when creating an issue (by clicking the Create button along the top), you can close the tab/window without the confirmation popping up. This makes it so users can lose their work while creating issues.

Many of our users sit on their Agile board view most of the time, thus making it likely for this event to occur and cause users to lose work.

This is using JIRA server 6.3.4 and JIRA Agile 6.6.80
fields.summary: Creating an issue while on an Agile Board doesn't catch closing tab/window

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On every startup JIRA is logging an ERROR about a missing file:

{noformat}
2015-04-30 10:42:50,703 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [atlassian.jira.tenancy.PluginKeyPredicateLoader] Could not read tenant-smart pattern file '/Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira641/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/tenant-smart-patterns.txt' (using defaults)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA.
# Start it up.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA does not report the file as missing.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA logs an ERROR that the file is missing.

h3. Notes

It appears to be missing in JIRA 6.4.1 and higher.
fields.summary: JIRA startup reports Could not read tenant-smart pattern file
OAuth 2.0 Support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43170].
  {panel}

I would like to add a multi-select custom field to my issues where the options link to a confluence page.

The particular case I would use it, is to associate an issue with one or more 'Personas'. Each of those can be described on a confluence page with a special 'persona' tag.

In edit mode, the field should provide the user a choice of confluence pages matching a certain query (in my case, all pages with the 'persona' tag). In view mode, the user should be able to click-through to the confluence page.

This should faciliate creating the link as
- the link can now be added (through the custom field) while Creating the issue
- The user does not have to go through the process of searching through all confluence pages, as only the limited set of pages matching a query is presented.

Something more static used to be possible with multi-select fields and HTML-coded links, but this has been disabled, as HTML is now escaped. 

JRA-6762 describes a similar issue, but this solution is also no longer available.
fields.summary: Custom Field pointing to one or more Confluence Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43168].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
User can add extra log work even when the Remaining Time is 0.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should has an option to block any user/group to add extra *log work* in *time spent* when the *Remaining Time* is already with the 0 value.

h3. Workaround
Time Sheet plugin by default, does not allow the user to add extra log work when the Remaining time is 0, so you can use it as a workaround.
!Screen Shot 2015-04-29 at 4.01.25 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't allow users to add extra log work in time spent when Remaining Time is 0

fields.description: We have this problem since at least 6.4.
fields.summary: Unable to focus attachment delete icon with TAB
Error while loading the Gadget/Jfree chart

fields.description:
The webhook configuration in JIRA Data Center is not consistent and synchronize between nodes instantly.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Setup JIRA with 2 nodes
# Create one webhook configuration in node 1
# Create one webhook configuration in node 2
# Refresh the webhook configuration page and it will only show one webhook for each nodes instead of showing two webhooks.

h4. Expected Results:
All webhook configuration will show in different nodes after refresh.

h4. Actual Results:
Webhook created in one node not viewable by another node. 

h4. Workaround:

Restart JIRA node will show all the configurations. However, restart is not a good workaround for huge instance that require multiple nodes at the same time for instance stability and performance.
fields.summary: Webhook configuration not synchronized in multiple nodes for JIRA Data Center
self servicing notification-schemes
User and Group Management events in JIRA audit log are anonymous

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43153].
  {panel}

To have JIRA to prompt out confirmation screen whenever in the process of editing the field's value in "View Screen"
* new values entered and confirmation for new values
* closing or navigating away

Among the situation that might happened which bugs the user currently:
* The Description field in a JIRA issue dynamically becomes an editable form when it is clicked. Pressing the ESC key reverts it to a non-editable component, discarding any changes made while it was editable.
* accidentally closing or navigating away from jira.
fields.summary: Confirmation whenever any changes to field value

fields.description:
The problem exists because we introduced CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore and I assume that DefaultApplicationLinkService didn't expect values to be cached.

Therefore logic in DefaultApplicationLinkService became obsolete. DefaultApplicationLinkService behaves as follows:
1. It uses lock (applicationIdsLock) to protect all writes to setApplicationIds which works on PropertySet
2. It does not use lock for accessing methods like getApplicationLink and getApplicationLinks
3. Because of the logic in JiraPluginSettings which for short period of time removes all values for given key, we have period of time when we can initialise cache with empty value for property set
4. Because of this next update to applinks results in empty value being written to DB.
fields.summary: CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore causes race condition on DefaultApplicationLinkService and removal of all applinks.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Try to attach a file more than 10 MB in Internet Explorer 11

h3. Expected Result
Error message should be shown
{code}
File exceeds maximum size limit set by the administrator (10.00 MB).
{code}

h3. Actual result
Nothing happens. No error will be shown

h3. Workaround
Navigate to: 

# Log in as a user with the *JIRA System Administrators* [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions].
# Select *Administration > System > Attachments* to open the *Attachments* page.
(/) [Keyboard shortcut|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts#UsingKeyboardShortcuts-administrationsearchdialogbox]: *g + g +* start typing *Attachments*.
# Edit Settings
# Increase the Attachment Size
fields.summary: No error will be shown if attachment is more than 10 MB, Internet Explorer

fields.description:
When we create an issue with multiple components via JIRA UI the assignee is always the lead for the first component alphabetically. 
However that is not the case when creating the issue via REST.

*Steps to reproduce*
Set component leads to be the default assignee
Create an issue with multiple components

*Expected Behaviour*
Assignee is the component lead for the first component alphabetically

*Actual Behaviour*
Issue is assigned to another component leads
fields.summary: Assignee not the expected Component lead via REST

# user selects a custom field value (i.e. "category" = "Development" )

Cheers,
